Class IntrinsicWeapon

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.weapons.IntrinsicWeapon
All Implemented Interfaces:
Weapon
Direct Known Subclasses:
BareFist, BareFist
public abstract class IntrinsicWeapon extends Object implements Weapon
Class that represents a weapon for an unarmed Actor (e.g. fists, claws, etc.) Since the attack is done without the use of any item, e.g., damage is dealt by punching the target using the actor's bare fist, it is semantically incorrect to make intrinsic weapon an item.
See Also:

    • IntrinsicWeapon

      public IntrinsicWeapon(int damage, String verb, int hitRate)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      damage - damage to health
      verb - a word that will be printed in the action, e.g. "punches"
      hitRate - the intrinsic weapon's chance to hit

  • Method Details

    • attack

      public String attack(Actor attacker, Actor target, GameMap map)
      Sample implementation of the attack method of the intrinsic weapon. If the hit rate is not met, the attacker misses the target. Otherwise, the target is hit, hurting the target by the intrinsic weapon's damage
      Specified by:
      attack in interface Weapon
      Parameters:
      attacker - the actor who performed the attack
      target - the actor who is the target of the attack
      map - the map on which the attack was executed
      Returns:
      the description once the attack is done
